entry.title: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR MOUNTAIN AREAS STARTING TUESDAY AFTERNOON
entry.summary: December 31, 2024 3:50 a.m. A Winter Weather Advisory is in effect from 4:00 p.m. Tuesday to 4:00 p.m. for mountain areas in parts of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service said snow is expected. Total accumulations between 5 and 10 inches, with higher amounts up to 13 inches above 5,500 are expected....

entry.title: GOVERNOR ORDERS FLAGS LOWERED TO HALF-STAFF FOR PRESIDENT CARTER
entry.summary: December 31, 2024 3:40 a.m. Monday, Governor Tina Kotek ordered flags at Oregon public institutions to be flown at half-staff, pursuant to a Presidential Proclamation, as a mark of respect for the memory of President Jimmy Carter. A release from the Governor’s office said the flag should be flown at half-staff until sunset on January...

entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY GOVERNMENT TO CLOSE ON NEWS YEAR’S DAY
entry.summary: December 31, 2024 3:30 a.m. Most Douglas County government offices will be closed on Wednesday for New Year’s Day. A county release said that includes offices at the courthouse, justice building, Courthouse Annex in Reedsport, transfer stations, fairgrounds, the museum in Roseburg, and all external county government offices. An exception is the Umpqua River Lighthouse...

entry.title: CITY OF ROSEBURG TO CLOSE FOR NEW YEAR’S DAY
entry.summary: December 31, 2024 3:20 a.m. The City of Roseburg will close for New Year’s Day on Wednesday. A city release said that means that city hall and the public safety center, both on Southeast Douglas Avenue, and the Roseburg Public Library on Northeast Diamond Lake Boulevard, will not be open to the public. entry.title: WALDRONS OUTDOOR SPORTS GETTING NEW OWNERS

entry.title: YONCALLA MAN JAILED IN ALLEGED IDENTITY THEFT CASE
entry.summary: December 31, 2024 2:50 a.m. A Yoncalla man was jailed Saturday in an alleged identity theft case. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at 9:55 a.m. a victim called dispatchers and said her credit card had been used without her permission. Later that day a deputy made contact with the suspect at his residence...

entry.title: ROSEBURG DISPOSAL COLLECTING CHRISTMAS TREES
entry.summary: December 30, 2024 3:05 a.m. Roseburg Disposal is collecting Christmas trees for free with dumpsters located around the Roseburg area. Only real trees will be accepted. No artificial trees, lights, ornaments, flocking, tinsel, trash or tree stands should be dropped off. Trees will be turned into clean mulch. Collection dumpsters are located at: *Legion Field...

entry.title: FESTIVAL OF LIGHTS CONTINUES THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING
entry.summary: The Umpqua Valley Festival of Lights continues through Wednesday evening. Presented by the Roseburg Rotary Club, the 32nd annual event features over 500,000 lights and 90 displays at River Forks Park, northwest of Roseburg. This year, there were a number of upgrades including a new 20-foot replica of the Umpqua Lighthouse and restoration work on...

entry.title: BLM CALL FOR APPLICATIONS: ARTIST IN RESIDENCE PROGRAM

entry.title: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 7:00 A.M. SUNDAY FOR SOUTHERN OREGON
entry.summary: December 29, 2024 5:50 a.m. The National Weather Service has issued a Flood Warning for much of southern Oregon through 7:00 a.m. Sunday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. The Warning area includes Douglas, Jackson, Josephine, Coos, and Curry counties....

entry.title: FLOOD WARNING FOR DEER CREEK AT ROSEBURG
entry.summary: December 29, 2024 5:40 a.m. A Flood Warning is in effect through Sunday evening for Deer Creek at Roseburg.
